thread.title: Paris Saint-Germain star Odsonne Edouard in police custody after ‘shooting a passer-by in the face’ with pellet gun
thread.title_full: Paris Saint-Germain star Odsonne Edouard in police custody after ‘shooting a passer-by in the face’ with pellet gun

author: dfraser
title: Paris Saint-Germain star Odsonne Edouard in police custody after ‘shooting a passer-by in the face’ with pellet gun
text:
EFL What're the Odsonne that? Paris Saint-Germain star Odsonne Edouard in police custody after ‘shooting a passer-by in the face’ with pellet gun 
French teenager, currently on loan at Toulouse, was caught on CCTV reportedly firing 'Airsoft' pellet at a stranger's head By Dave Fraser 30th March 2017, 11:30 am Updated: 30th March 2017, 1:10 pm Comments PARIS SAINT-GERMAIN star Odsonne Edouard is reportedly in police custody after ‘shooting a passer-by in the face’. 
The French forward, 19, is said to have been caught on CCTV in his car moments before someone fired an Airsoft pellet at the head of an innocent bystander. Getty Images 4 Odsonne Edouard reportedly fired a pellet at a passer-by’s face 
Edouard meanwhile has rejected the claim, saying he had lent his car to a friend for that day and wasn’t present for the attack. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
The identity of the shooter is yet to be officially named. 
It’s not just off the pitch the young forward has struggled either. Getty Images Odsonne Edouard is currently at Ligue 1 side Toulouse on loan Getty Images 4 The Paris Saint-Germain star has turned out for France at Under-17, 18 and 19 level 
Edouard has only managed to score one goal for Ligue 1 side Toulouse this season, despite taking to the pitch 17 times in all competitions, as the club sit 12th in the table, with just nine wins from their 30 games. 
The French Guiana-born attacker joined Paris Saint-Germain in 2011 after working through the youth ranks at AF Bobigny. 
However, after failing to break into the first team – with only a handful of ‘B’ team appearances in 2015-16 – he was shipped off on a season-long loan to Toulouse. Reuters 4 Odsonne Edouard is yet to break into the Paris Saint-Germain first-team 
Edouard has also turned out for France at the Under-17, Under-18 and Under-19 level, while helping the PSG youth side to the runners-up spot in the 2015-16 Uefa Youth League. 
The 19-year-old is being tipped for big things having been the top scorer at the Uefa European Under-17 Football Championship – also winning the Golden Player award in the process.
